Game Of Warweb app

ReactJS

GitHub Repo Live version

This is an application where a player can play against the computer in a game of War. It is built using ReactJS with an emphasis on Fetch Api with {useState}. I also deviated in this project with the addition of Twitter Bootstrap to build Modals to inform players who won hands and the game overall. The page uses Flexbox for the layout. It was built as the final project of Scrimba's Frontend Developer Career Path.

The project was in the API module at Scrimba. There wasn't anything particularly difficult about the call to the RESTful API so much of the difficulty was in creating the vanilla javascript logic to determine winners of each hand and overall winner. In order to push myself I added the Modals and practiced SetTimeout to display messages after each hand so that users would know what was happening in the game.

The interesting thing to me was that before React I had heavily relied on Bootstrap to handle much of my layout and components which is why I used bootstrap modal but after finishing I had a stronger urge to use flexbox for my layouts and see if I could build my own custom components for more apps rather than rely on their components.
